intro: Scaevola argentea, commonly known as silver fanflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is often grown as an ornamental due to its attractive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Scaevola argentea is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
